front.title: Specification for the Derivation of Root Keys from an Extended Master Session Key (EMSK)

abstract.t: An Extended Master Session Key (EMSK) is a cryptographic key generated from an Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) exchange reserved solely for the purpose of deriving master keys for one or more purposes identified as usage definitions. This memo specifies a mechanism for avoiding conflicts between root keys by deriving cryptographically separate keys from the EMSK. This document also describes a usage for domain specific root keys made available to and used within specific key management domains.
